document_data.name: Cone of Earth
document_data.refs2e: {{Cite dragon/250/Arcane Lore: Secrets of the Arch-Geomancer}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Cone of earth''''' was an [[evocation]] and [[Elemental earth school|elemental earth]] [[spell]] from [[Zakhara]]'s ancient empire of [[Kadar]].
document_data.Effects: As the name said, this spell invoked a cone of earth that shot away from the caster, hurting and possibly burying its intended victim. It only functioned if the wizard was standing on earthy ground.
document_data.Components: Aside from [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s, ''cone of earth'' required a small amount of [[Pyrite|fool's gold]] as a [[material component]].
document_data.History:
The spell ''cone of earth'' was employed by the [[geomancers]] of the [[Cities of the Ancients|Ruined Kingdom]] of Kadar in eastern Zakhara. It was contained in the [[Kitab al-Asfr]], the spellbook penned by the geomancer [[Balshareska]], shortly before she achieved her goal to become Tisan, greatest (and last) holder of power within Kadar.

With the fall of the geomancers and the centuries-long imprisonment of Tisan, the spell was also lost. After her second defeat in [[1367 DR]],{{AQ-time}} the Kitab al-Asafr and the magic within began circulating again in the Land of Fate.
